types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The javascript `Date` as string. Type represents date and time as the ISO Date string.

types.name: FunnelType
types.description: Funnel type

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: PaymentMethod
types.description: Payment method

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: availableShippingRates
fields.description:
The available shipping rates for the draft order. Requires a customer with a
valid shipping address and at least one line item.

types.name: ShippingRate
types.description: A shipping rate to be applied to an order.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: Human-readable unique identifier for this shipping rate.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price of this shipping rate.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of this shipping rate.

types.name: Money
types.description: Money A monetary value string. Example value: "100.57".

types.name: DraftOrder
types.description: Represents a draft order. Merchants can use draft orders to create orders on behalf of their customers.

fields.name: appliedDiscount
fields.description: Order-level discount applied to the draft order.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description: Billing address of the customer.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the draft order converted to a new order,
and the draft order's status changed to **Completed**.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the draft order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Three letter code for the currency of the store at the time that the invoice is sent.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address of the customer, which is used to send notifications to.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: invoiceUrl
fields.description: Link to the checkout, which is sent to your customer in the invoice email.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: List of the line items in the draft order.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Unique identifier for the draft order, which is unique within the store. For example, _#D1223_.

fields.name: orderId
fields.description: Order that was created from this draft order.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: Shipping mailing address of the customer.

fields.name: shippingLine
fields.description: Line item that contains the shipping costs.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the draft order.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description: Subtotal of the line items and their discounts (does not contain shipping charges or shipping discounts, or taxes).

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description: Total amount of the draft order (includes taxes, shipping charges, and discounts).

fields.name: totalShippingPrice
fields.description: Total shipping charge for the draft order.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: Total amount of taxes for the draft order.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Date and time when the draft order was last changed.

types.name: DraftOrderAppliedDiscount
types.description: The order-level discount applied to a draft order.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amount of money discounted.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the order-level discount.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of the order-level discount.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
Amount of the order level discount (when value_type is percentage,
the value in this field is the percentage discount).

fields.name: valueType
fields.description: Type of the order-level discount.

types.name: DraftOrderAppliedDiscountType
types.description: The valid discount types that can be applied to a draft order.

types.name: MailingAddress
types.description:
Represents a customer mailing address.

For example, a customer's default address and an order's billing address are both mailling addresses.

fields.name: address1
fields.description: The first line of the address. Typically the street address or PO Box number.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: The second line of the address. Typically the number of the apartment, suite, or unit.

fields.name: city
fields.description: The name of the city, district, village, or town.

fields.name: company
fields.description: The name of the customer's company or organization.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the country of the address.

For example, US.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The first name of the customer.

fields.name: formattedArea
fields.description: A comma-separated list of the values for city, province, and country.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The last name of the customer.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude coordinate of the customer address.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude coordinate of the customer address.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The full name of the customer, based on firstName and lastName.

fields.name: phone
fields.description:
A unique phone number for the customer.

Formatted using E.164 standard. For example, _+16135551111_.

fields.name: province
fields.description: The region of the address, such as the province, state, or district.

fields.name: provinceCode
fields.description:
The two-letter code for the region.

For example, ON.

fields.name: zip
fields.description: The zip or postal code of the address.

types.name: CountryCode
types.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes with some differences.

types.name: CurrencyCode
types.description: Currency codes

types.name: DraftOrderLineItem
types.description: Represents a line item included in a draft order.

fields.name: appliedDiscount
fields.description: Discount which will be applied to the line item or the overall order.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: Line item price after discounts are applied.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The `discountedTotal` divided by `quantity`, resulting in the value of the discount per unit.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the draft order line item.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the product.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied.

fields.name: productId
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Number of variant items requested in the draft order.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the product or variant (this field only applies to custom line items).

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: Total value of the discount applied to the line item.

fields.name: variantId
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Name of the variant.

types.name: Image
types.description: Represents an image resource.

fields.name: altText
fields.description: A word or phrase to share the nature or contents of an image.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the image.

fields.name: originalSrc
fields.description:
The location of the original image as a URL.

If there are any existing transformations in the original source URL, they will remain and not be stripped.

fields.name: transformedSrc
fields.description:
The location of the transformed image as a URL.

All transformation arguments are considered "best-effort". If they can be applied to an image, they will be.
Otherwise any transformations which an image type does not support will be ignored.

types.name: URL
types.description:
An RFC 3986 and RFC 3987 compliant URI string.
Example value: "https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com".

types.name: ShippingLine
types.description: Represents the shipping details that the customer chose for their order.

fields.name: custom
fields.description: Whether the shipping line is custom.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: A unique identifier for the shipping rate. The format can change without notice and is not meant to be shown to users.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Returns the title of the shipping line.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The pre-tax shipping price without any discounts applied in shop and presentment currencies.

types.name: DraftOrderStatus
types.description: The valid statuses for a draft order.

types.name: CheckoutStatus
types.description: Checkout status

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: PerformanceReportGroupBy
types.description: Performance report group by

types.name: ShippingLineInput
types.description: Specifies the shipping details for the order.

inputFields.name: handle
inputFields.description: A unique identifier for the shipping rate.

types.name: MailingAddressInput
types.description: The fields used to create or update a mailing address.

inputFields.name: address1
inputFields.description: The first line of the address. Typically the street address or PO Box number.

inputFields.name: address2
inputFields.description: The second line of the address. Typically the number of the apartment, suite, or unit.

inputFields.name: city
inputFields.description: The name of the city, district, village, or town.

inputFields.name: company
inputFields.description: The name of the customer's company or organization.

inputFields.name: country
inputFields.description: The name of the country. This argument is deprecated: Use `countryCode` instead.

inputFields.name: countryCode
inputFields.description: The two-letter code for the country of the address.

inputFields.name: firstName
inputFields.description: The first name of the customer.

inputFields.name: lastName
inputFields.description: The last name of the customer.

inputFields.name: phone
inputFields.description:
A unique phone number for the customer.

Formatted using E.164 standard. For example, _+16135551111_.

inputFields.name: province
inputFields.description:
The region of the address, such as the province, state, or district. This
argument is deprecated: Use `provinceCode` instead.

inputFields.name: provinceCode
inputFields.description:
The code for the region of the address, such as the province, state, or district.
For example QC for Quebec, Canada.

inputFields.name: zip
inputFields.description: The zip or postal code of the address.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: PaymentStatus
types.description: Payment status

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: client
directives.description: Direct the client to resolve this field locally, either from the cache or local resolvers.

args.name: always
args.description:
When true, the client will never use the cache for this value. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#forcing-resolvers-with-clientalways-true

directives.name: export
directives.description:
Export this locally resolved field as a variable to be used in the remainder of this query. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#using-client-fields-as-variables

args.name: as
args.description: The variable name to export this field as.

directives.name: connection
directives.description:
Specify a custom store key for this result. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/advanced/caching/#the-connection-directive

args.name: filter
args.description: An array of query argument names to include in the generated custom store key.
